RTCRtpStreamStatsKind.summary:
The kind property of the
dictionary is a string indicating whether the
described RTP stream contains audio or video media.

remarks.para:
Its value
is always either "audio" or "video".

This property was previously called mediaType. The name was changed in the
specification in February, 2018. See Browser compatibility below to
determine how this affects the browsers you're targeting.

RTCRtpStreamStatsKind.value:
A string whose value is "audio" if the track whose
statistics are given by the RTCRtpStreamStats object contains audio, or
"video" if the track contains video media.This string will always be the same as the one provided by the associated
object's
property. It will also match the statistics object's
property's media type.
